basicConcept.title: Basic Concept
basicConcept.description: Hanafuda is a traditional Japanese card game using 48 cards divided into 12 suits, each representing a month. "Koi-Koi" is one of the most popular ways to play Hanafuda.

hikari.name: Hikari (Bright)
hikari.description: Highest value cards, 5 cards total, 20 points each

tane.name: Tane (Animal)
tane.description: Cards with animal patterns, 9 cards total, 10 points each

tan.name: Tanzaku (Ribbon)

kasu.description: Plain cards, 24 cards total, 1 point each

gameFlow.title: Game Flow
steps: Each player gets 8 hand cards, 8 cards placed on field
Take turns playing cards, matching with same month on field
If matched successfully, take both cards
Draw one card from deck, attempt to match similarly
When someone forms a yaku, can choose "Koi-Koi" or end

inoshikacho.name: Ino-Shika-Chō (Boar-Deer-Butterfly)
inoshikacho.description: Collect Tane cards of Bush Clover, Maple, and Peony

akatan.name: Aka-tan (Red Ribbons)
akatan.description: Collect Tanzaku of Pine, Plum, and Cherry

strategy.title: "Koi-Koi" Strategy
strategy.description: When you form a yaku, you can choose:
options: End game: Immediately get current score
Declare "Koi-Koi": Continue game aiming for more yaku, but risk opponent's comeback
strategy.bonus: After declaring "Koi-Koi", if you win in the end, your score will be doubled!
